definitions.definition: To attempt to stop the progression of; to resist or antagonize by physical means, or by arguments, etc.; to contend against.
examples: to oppose the king in battle
to oppose a bill in Congress
There is still time to oppose this plan.
Many religious leaders oppose cloning humans.

definitions.definition: To present or set up in opposition; to pose .
examples: They are opposed to any form of hierarchy.

definitions.definition: To place in front of, or over against; to set opposite; to exhibit.

main_definition: To attempt to stop the progression of; to resist or antagonize by physical means, or by arguments, etc.; to contend against.
secondary_definitions: To present or set up in opposition; to pose .
To place in front of, or over against; to set opposite; to exhibit.
